trans-unit.source: Provides an interface to a given variable that is defined in the style sheet during runtime execution.

For more information on using IXsltContextVariable , see article Q324899, "HOW TO: Implement and Use Custom Functions When You Execute XPath Queries in Visual Basic .NET" in the Microsoft Knowledge Base at http://support.microsoft.com.
Evaluates the variable at runtime and returns an object that represents the value of the variable.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Xsl.XsltContext"></xref> representing the execution context of the variable.
An <xref:System.Object> representing the value of the variable.
Possible return types include number, string, Boolean, document fragment, or node set.
Gets a value indicating whether the variable is local.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the variable is a local variable in the current context; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the variable is an Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformations (XSLT) parameter.
This can be a parameter to a style sheet or a template.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the variable is an XSLT parameter; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathResultType"></xref> representing the XML Path Language (XPath) type of the variable.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XPath.XPathResultType"></xref> representing the XPath type of the variable.
